title: New Numerals for Old Font
content:
We have a font that I've made some numerals to go along with because it didn't come with any. All comments welcome:
image.swf
fancyblock.swf (6 k)
author: graficartist

comments.content:
I think they work pretty well.   
I can think of a few tweaks here and there, but the biggest thing is the bottom serif of the "7": too jarring. Solution? I can't seem to think of one... :-/   
   
hhp

Try this:   
The foot serif of the "7" might be fixed by narrowing it slightly and smoothing the bracketing. Use the "4" as a guide, as much as feasible, only make it slightly wider.   
   
Good luck! The numeral set looks like a nice solution overall.   
   
David
the 7 is absolutely the weakest part of the numerals. I'll play with it some more and see what I can come up with. Thanks.
